action.description:
Callback fired when the component mounts.
This is useful when you want to trigger an action programmatically.
It supports two actions: `updateIndicator()` and `updateScrollButtons()`

tags.title: param
tags.description:
This object contains all possible actions
that can be triggered programmatically.
tags.name: actions

aria-label.description: The label for the Tabs as a string.

aria-labelledby.description: An id or list of ids separated by a space that label the Tabs.

centered.description:
If `true`, the tabs will be centered.
This property is intended for large views.

classes.description:
Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
See [CSS API](#css) below for more details.

component.description:
The component used for the root node.
Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.

indicatorColor.description: Determines the color of the indicator.

onChange.description: Callback fired when the value changes.

tags.title: param
tags.description: The event source of the callback. **Warning**: This is a generic event not a change event.
tags.name: event

tags.title: param
tags.description: We default to the index of the child (number)
tags.name: value

ScrollButtonComponent.description: The component used to render the scroll buttons.

scrollButtons.description:
Determine behavior of scroll buttons when tabs are set to scroll:

- `auto` will only present them when not all the items are visible.
- `desktop` will only present them on medium and larger viewports.
- `on` will always present them.
- `off` will never present them.

selectionFollowsFocus.description:
If `true` the selected tab changes on focus. Otherwise it only
changes on activation.

TabIndicatorProps.description: Props applied to the tab indicator element.

value.description:
The value of the currently selected `Tab`.
If you don't want any selected `Tab`, you can set this property to `false`.

variant.description:
Determines additional display behavior of the tabs:

 - `scrollable` will invoke scrolling properties and allow for horizontally
 scrolling (or swiping) of the tab bar.
 -`fullWidth` will make the tabs grow to use all the available space,
 which should be used for small views, like on mobile.
 - `standard` will render the default state.

descriptions.root: Styles applied to the root element.
descriptions.vertical: Styles applied to the root element if `orientation="vertical"`.
descriptions.flexContainer: Styles applied to the flex container element.
descriptions.flexContainerVertical: Styles applied to the flex container element if `orientation="vertical"`.
descriptions.centered: Styles applied to the flex container element if `centered={true}` & `!variant="scrollable"`.
descriptions.scroller: Styles applied to the tablist element.
descriptions.fixed: Styles applied to the tablist element if `!variant="scrollable"`   .
descriptions.scrollable: Styles applied to the tablist element if `variant="scrollable"`.
descriptions.scrollButtonsDesktop: Styles applied to the `ScrollButtonComponent` component if `scrollButtons="auto"` or scrollButtons="desktop"`.
